intro: Lotononis densa subsp. congesta, commonly known as the dense lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flower heads that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
